titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for Patrick Vincent McMenamy photograph collection 1918-1919 and 1990s.
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Polly Reynolds

publicationstmt.publisher: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created by Polly Reynolds 2005-09
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English.

titlepage.publisher:
Michigan Historical Collections
Bentley Historical Library
University of Michigan
titlepage.titleproper:
Finding Aid for
Patrick Vincent McMenamy photograph collection, 1918-1919 and 1990s.
titlepage.author:
Finding aid prepared by:
Polly Reynolds, Sept. 2005

did.abstract: Born in St. Louis, Mo., member of Company D, U.S. 339th Infantry who served in the Allied intervention in Russia, 1918-1920, the "Polar Bear Expedition."

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by James M. Thompson, of South Bend, Indiana, in 2005 (Donor no.: 9619).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., Patrick Vincent McMenamy photograph collection, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Born in St. Louis, Mo. served in Company D, U.S. 339th Infantry during the American intervention at Archangel, Russia.

scopecontent.p: Portrait, group photo of 339th Infantry, and photo of his grave marker.
